00010 // Based on TObjArray, this is a simple collection class to hold a list
00011 // of KEvent objects. It can hold any type of event that inherits 
00012 // from KEvent. 
00013 //
00014 #include "KEventCollection.h"
00015 #include "KEvent.h"
00016 #include "KEventFactory.h"
00017 
00018 ClassImp(KEventCollection);
00019 
00020 KEventCollection::KEventCollection(Int_t s, Int_t lowerBound)
00021 : TObjArray(s, lowerBound)
00022 {
00023         SetOwner();  
00024         InitializeMembers();
00025 }
00026 
00027 KEventCollection::~KEventCollection(void)
00028 {
00029   //Does calling clear at destruction take too much computing time?
00030   Clear("C");
00031         
00032 }
00033 
00034 void KEventCollection::Clear(Option_t* anOpt)
00035 {
00036   //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00037   //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00038   //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00039   //inside of a TClonesArray
00040   //Also, if this class holds any TClonesArrays, it must call
00041   //TClonesArray::Clear("C")
00042         TObjArray::Clear(anOpt);
00043         
00044   //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00045 
00046   //Re initialize local members here and prepare for the next use of this class.
00047   InitializeMembers();
00048 
00049 }
00050

00053         //
00054         
00055   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00056   //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00057 
00058 }

00060 void KEventCollection::AddEvent(const KEvent *anEvent)
00061 {
00062         //Add an event to your collection. This calls TObjArray::Add.
00063         
00064         TObjArray::Add(KEventFactory::NewEvent(anEvent));
00065         
00066 }
